commitMessage:
feat(harden): consolidate critical files into review manifest

## What Changed
- Enhanced ReviewManifest interface with critical_files section (review-manifest.ts:74)
- Added buildCriticalFilesSection() method to ReviewManifestGenerator (464 lines)
- Updated ReviewEngineService to pass critical files data to manifest generator (line 96)
- Fixed TypeScript error: removed unused changedFiles parameter from displayReviewSummary()
- Updated /harden template to reference manifest critical_files instead of separate file
- Added 2 smoke tests for critical_files functionality (lines 289-341)
- Auto-generated claude-commands.ts synced from slash command updates

## Why This Change
HODGE-360 eliminates file duplication in the harden workflow by consolidating critical files analysis into the review-manifest.yaml. Previously, the same file metadata appeared in both critical-files.md (top 10 ranked files) and review-manifest.yaml (all changed files), creating redundancy and confusion.

The consolidated approach provides:
- Single source of truth for file metadata in review-manifest.yaml
- Reduced file count from 5 to 3 data files in harden directory
- Cleaner harden directory with only essential data files
- Backward compatible (critical_files is optional field)

## Impact
- Token efficiency: AI reads one manifest instead of multiple files
- Maintainability: One place to update file prioritization logic
- User experience: Cleaner harden directory, clearer workflow
- Development velocity: Reduced cognitive load during code review
- All 1343 tests passing, zero TypeScript errors
- Production ready with 2 acceptable warnings (1.13% test duplication, auto-generated file orphan)
